intro: Espeletiopsis diazii, commonly known as the Colombian nutmeg tree, is a member of the Myristicaceae family and is native to the Andean region of Colombia. It is a small to medium-sized evergreen tree that can reach heights of up to 10 meters. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Its fruit is a capsule that contains aromatic seeds, which are used in traditional medicine and local cuisine. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
